str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: From leitourgos; to be a public servant, i.e. to perform religious or charitable functions.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: To fast, abstain from food. From nestis; to abstain from food.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred. From hagos; sacred.
Wind, breath, spirit.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To rail off, separate, place apart. From apo and horizo; to set off by boundary, i.e. limit, exclude, appoint, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Of Chaldee origin; son of Nabas; Barnabas, an Israelite.
And, even, also, namely.
Saul, the apostle. Of Hebrew origin, the same as Saoul; Saulus, the Jewish name of Paul.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: To call to myself, summon. Middle voice from pros and kaleo; to call toward oneself, i.e. Summon, invite.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
